name: Community software tools for ngs
body:
### ClinVar Tools on github


[Metatoolstest](https://hermesfj.github.io/SNPs/ "Metatools")

[Abramconnelly](https://github.com/abramconnelly/clinvar-report)  
* Files parsed/used: xml and text
* Output: Text custom for their workflow and TSV
* Output columns: Chromosome, Position, Name, Significance, Frequency, Zygosity, ACC URL  

[Agermanidis](https://github.com/agermanidis/ClinVar)
* A tool for transforming a XML datasource into JSON documents according to a specified schema. The tool lets you define a simple schema in a python dict (schema.py). --> The script uses a simple DSL to specify the fields to extract from the input XML to produce the output.
       
[Alexhnrie](https://github.com/alexhenrie/clinvar-for-nerds)
* ClinVar for Nerds is a web-based interface to query ClinVar data and download it in CSV, JSON, VCF, JSON-LD (RDF model based JSON) format. The project setup downloads the clinvar full xml, parses it into json objects and dumps them in a mongodb instance. After that you can query the data in mongodb.
The web interface can take a file format, multiple "restriction" filters as inputs.
         
[ClinGen](https://github.com/ClinGen/clinvar-demo)
* Demonstration of the genboree.com REST API on a website using a React component to retrieve and display data.
         
[Clingendb](https://github.com/clingendb/clinvar_xml_pipe)    
* The ClinVar database, maintained by the National Center for Biotechnology information (NCBI), provides information about medically important variants with associated phenotypes and effects of sequence changes. 
        
[Dakl](https://github.com/dakl/macarthur-clinvar-to-vcf)    
* The MacArthur lab has made a great effort make ClinVar data more available to the bioinformatics community. This script converts their flat file to a VCF file. 
          
[Ianjw11](https://github.com/ianjw11/clinvarparser)    
* to run converter script:
python run.py --source /path/to/clinvar.xml --output /path/to/output.json
     
[MacArthur](https://github.com/macarthur-lab/clinvar)  
* This repo provides tools to convert ClinVar data into a tab-delimited flat file, and also provides that resulting tab-delimited flat file.
      
[PersonalGenomesOrg](https://github.com/PersonalGenomesOrg/vcf2clinvar)     
* Generate a report based on matching a genome VCF to the VCF version of ClinVar's variant database. (possibly related to https://github.com/abramconnelly/clinvar-report, same team etc.) This code is intended to be used as a module (installable via pip), for use in other systems or pipelines.
        
[Pidr](https://github.com/pidr/clinvar-rdfizer)   
          
[Rbagnall](https://github.com/rbagnall/clinvar_parser)   
* Used to format Clinvar pathogenicity predictions into a snp hash table and indel hash table. Puts mutliple predictions for the same nucleotide into one line. Usage clinvar_parser.pl variant_summary.txt.
         
[Sephraim](https://github.com/sephraim/convert_ClinVar_XML_to_VCF)     
* 
  
[Welchbm](https://github.com/welchbm/VisualizeClinvar)        


***

### Metagenomics Tools
[AmphoraNet](http://pitgroup.org/amphoranet/)     
[ClaMS](http://clams.jgi-psf.org/)    
[Clark](http://clark.cs.ucr.edu/)          
[CoMet-Universe](http://comet2.gobics.de/)                 
[EBI Metagenomics](https://www.ebi.ac.uk/metagenomics/)     
[EstimateS](http://viceroy.eeb.uconn.edu/EstimateS/)     
[E-vident](https://github.com/biocore/Evident/)     
[Fantom](http://www.sysbio.se/Fantom/)     
[FLASh](http://ccb.jhu.edu/software/FLASH/)           
[Genometa](http://genomics1.mh-hannover.de/genometa/)      
[Glimmer-MG](http://www.cbcb.umd.edu/software/glimmer-mg/)     
[GOTTCHA](http://lanl-bioinformatics.github.io/GOTTCHA/)      
[IMG/M](https://img.jgi.doe.gov/cgi-bin/m/main.cgi)     
[iPlant] (https://pods.iplantcollaborative.org/wiki/display/WiNGS/Scalable+metagenomic+analysis+using+iPlant)     
[Kraken](https://ccb.jhu.edu/software/kraken/)     
[MEGAN6](http://ab.inf.uni-tuebingen.de/software/megan6/)      
[MetaABC](http://metaabc.iis.sinica.edu.tw/)     
[METAGENassist](http://www.metagenassist.ca/METAGENassist/faces/Home.jsp)     
[metagenomeSeq](http://www.cbcb.umd.edu/software/metagenomeSeq)     
[Meta-IDBA](http://i.cs.hku.hk/~alse/hkubrg/projects/metaidba/)      
[metaMicrobesOnline](http://meta.microbesonline.org/)     
[MetAMOS](https://github.com/marbl/metAMOS)     
[MetaPhlAn](http://huttenhower.sph.harvard.edu/metaphlan)                    
[MetaPhyler](http://metaphyler.cbcb.umd.edu/)      
[Metarep](http://jcvi.org/metarep/)     
[MetaVelvet](http://metavelvet.dna.bio.keio.ac.jp/)     
[METAVIR](http://metavir-meb.univ-bpclermont.fr/)     
[Mothur](http://www.mothur.org/)     
[My Taxa](http://enve-omics.ce.gatech.edu/mytaxa/)    
[One Codex](https://www.onecodex.com/)     
[Panda](https://github.com/neufeld/pandaseq)     
[PEAR](http://www.exelixis-lab.org/pear)      
[PhymmlBL](http://www.cbcb.umd.edu/software/phymm/)       
[QIIME](http://qiime.org/install/virtual_box.html)         
[Real Time Metagenomics](http://edwards.sdsu.edu/RTMg/)        
[Ribosomal Database Project](http://rdp.cme.msu.edu/misc/about.jsp)      
[SMASHCommunity](http://www.bork.embl.de/software/smash/)      
[Taxator-tk](https://omictools.com/taxator-tk-tool)      
[VIROME](http://virome.dbi.udel.edu/)           
[Xander](https://github.com/rdpstaff/Xander_assembler)     
[ZORRO](http://journals.plos.org/plosone/article?id=10.1371/journal.pone.0030288)     

***

### Other Tools
[SiRen](http://www.eecs.berkeley.edu/Pubs/TechRpts/2015/EECS-2015-159.pdf)     
[Stampy](http://www.well.ox.ac.uk/project-stampy)         

***

### Structural Variant Tools
[ERDS](https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC3511991/)     
[ForestSV](http://sebatlab.ucsd.edu/index.php/software-data)     
[GRIDSS](https://github.com/PapenfussLab/gridss)     
[inGAP-sv](http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC3125812/)      
[Lumpy](https://github.com/arq5x/lumpy-sv)       
[SV-Bay](https://github.com/InstitutCurie/SV-Bay)      
[VariationHunter](http://compbio.cs.sfu.ca/software-variation-hunter)      


### Authors and Contributors
You can @mention a GitHub username to generate a link to their profile. The resulting `<a>` element will link to the contributor’s GitHub Profile. For example: In 2007, Chris Wanstrath (@defunkt), PJ Hyett (@pjhyett), and Tom Preston-Werner (@mojombo) founded GitHub.

### Support or Contact
Having trouble with Pages? Check out our [documentation](https://help.github.com/pages) or [contact support](https://github.com/contact) and we’ll help you sort it out.
